meanings.definition: The quality of being trustworthy or consistent.
meanings.sent1: Her reliability in completing tasks on time earned her the team's trust.
meanings.sent2: The reliability of the old car surprised everyone when it started on the first try.
meanings.sent3: The robot's reliability in making pancakes made it the star of the breakfast party.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse's reliability in guiding ships safely through the night was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The reliability of the weather forecast saved the picnic from being rained out.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something can be depended on.
meanings.sent1: The reliability of the bridge was crucial for the safety of the travelers.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the reliability of my alarm clock; it always wakes me up on time.
meanings.sent3: The reliability of the magic potion to cure hiccups was a hit at the wizard's party.
meanings.sent4: The reliability of the internet connection determined the success of the online meeting.
meanings.sent5: The reliability of the compass guided the hikers safely through the dense forest.
